name: Girls Into VC at Berkeley
description:
Historically, venture capital is a male-dominated field, lacking diversity on the investment team. Women account for only 9% of venture capitalists, 8% of firm partners, and 7% of board seats. This not only negatively affects women interested in the field, but also companies and entrepreneurs. Many women are not taught about venture capital, think joining the field is an unattainable goal, and are discouraged from joining clubs or startups because of their gender. As a result, women are not being invested in because women are not making these decisions.

 

Girls Into VC at Berkeley is dedicated to increasing the number of women in venture capital. The organization is many things – an advocacy organization, a professional development network, and a supportive community of friends. Through the organization, members will learn about the field, build practical knowledge, grow their network in the industry, and gain a supportive community of women interested in VC! There will be education about venture capital, speaker events, pitch competitions to encourage female entrepreneurs, partnerships with firms and incubators, and more!


This club will be a chapter of the larger Girls Into VC organization. In just over a year, Girls Into VC has grown to 5K+ members and 100+ mentors in 60+ countries and 6 continents. 

 

We create weekly content, including podcasts highlighting prominent figures in VC, newsletters, blog posts, and more. We also have designed, launched, and manage multiple programs, including the Mentorship Program where applicants are paired with women in established funds, Externship Program where members work with startups on substantial 8-week projects, Scout Program where members meet with women-led startups and share their memos with our network VCs, and Fellowship Program where accepted students take part in a 10-week comprehensive introduction to VC. We also established the Girls Into VC Summit, bringing together 250 members for panels, workshops, and a pitch competition. Girls Into VC has been highlighted in several media outlets including Forbes 30 Under 30.
summary: Girls Into VC at Berkeley empowers women in Venture Capital (VC) by providing hands-on learning, mentorship, and networking. We address gender gaps by fostering a community where aspiring female VCs gain the skills, knowledge, and support to succeed.
